byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Melissa Eddy from Weimar, Germany. Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, Katarina Johannsen from Berlin, and Safak Timur from Istanbul.
byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and MELISSA EDDY

abstract: Turkish government denounces German Parliament for adopting resolution declaring 1915 massacre of Armenians by Ottoman Turks was genocide; move complicates recent agreement enlisting Turkey's help in stemming flow of migrants from Middle East into Europe.
lead_paragraph: The Turkish government angrily denounced the vote as “null and void” and recalled its ambassador.

headline.main: German Parliament Recognizes Armenian Genocide, Angering Turkey
headline.print_headline: German Parliament Recognizes Armenian Genocide, Angering Turkey

snippet: The Turkish government angrily denounced the vote as “null and void” and recalled its ambassador.
